meanings.definition: Capable of being settled by arbitration.
meanings.sent1: The dispute was arbitrable, so they decided to resolve it through arbitration.
meanings.sent2: The contract clearly stated that any disagreements would be arbitrable.
meanings.sent3: It was quite funny to see the cat and dog in an arbitrable argument over who gets the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an arbitrable court, weighing the evidence before making a decision.
meanings.sent5: The image of the two teams in a heated but arbitrable debate will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.sent1: The case was easily arbitrable, so they proceeded with the arbitration process.
meanings.sent2: The new policy made all disputes arbitrable, ensuring a fair resolution for all.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch the robots in an arbitrable battle to determine who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like the air before an arbitrable storm.
meanings.sent5: The concept of justice being arbitrable among nations is both fascinating and complex.
